tourBios.curYrHigh: Recaptured a fully exempt PGA TOUR China Series' status by finishing T12 at the First Global Qualifying Tournament in Kunming. Began the final round outside the top 15—tied for 24th—but a 5-under 67, the low round of the day, moved him into the fully exempt position.
tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Made his PGA TOUR debut when he earned a playing spot in the Puerto Rico Open. Opened with a 76 but made the cut with a 2-under 70 in the second round. Finished T47 after firing a final-round 68 at Trump International GC...In eight Ping An Bank China Tour - PGA TOUR China Series' starts, enjoyed a pair of top-20 finishes, with his best outing a T12 at the Lushan Open in October. 

2014: Saw considerable action on the Mackenzie Tour - PGA TOUR Canada. Best finish on that circuit was a T25 at the Suncrude Boreal Open, with an opening 68 and a closing 69 giving him the top-25 showing…Added a T31 in his next start, at the Bayview Place Island Savings Open. A pair of 69s in the first and final rounds helped the cause…Played on the Asian Tour, with one Asian Development Tour start to his credit. On the ADT, secured his only top-10 of the campaign, a T9, shooting rounds of 67-70-71-67 at the PGM Port Dickson Championship… Played in the Asian Tour's Macau Open and was 64th…Top Asian Tour finish was a T42 at the Solaire Open in mid-March…At the Web.com Tour's second-stage Qualifying Tournament, didn't get through to the finals after finishing 40th.  

2013: Played eight Mackenzie Tour - PGA TOUR Canada events, making five cuts. Only top-10 was a T5 at The Tour Championship following an 8-under 64 in the second round. Only other top-20 outing was a T14 at the Wildfire Invitational, on the strength of a 67-68 weekend.
tourBios.personal: Sister is LPGA star Danielle Kang.
tourBios.otherInfo: Played college golf at San Diego State University.

2014: Saw considerable action on the Mackenzie Tour - PGA TOUR Canada. Best finish on that circuit was a T25 at the Suncrude Boreal Open, with an opening 68 and a closing 69 giving him the top-25 showing…Added a T31 in his next start, at the Bayview Place Island Savings Open. A pair of 69s in the first and final rounds helped the cause…Played on the Asian Tour, with one Asian Development Tour start to his credit. On the ADT, secured his only top-10 of the campaign, a T9, shooting rounds of 67-70-71-67 at the PGM Port Dickson Championship… Played in the Asian Tour's Macau Open and was 64th…Top Asian Tour finish was a T42 at the Solaire Open in mid-March…At the Web.com Tour's second-stage Qualifying Tournament, didn't get through to the finals after finishing 40th.  

2013: Played eight Mackenzie Tour - PGA TOUR Canada events, making five cuts. Only top-10 was a T5 at The Tour Championship following an 8-under 64 in the second round. Only other top-20 outing was a T14 at the Wildfire Invitational, on the strength of a 67-68 weekend.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Played collegiate golf at San Diego State University in California between 2008 and 2012. Was an All-Mountain West Conference selection in 2011, the same year he earned Ping All-West Region honors…Won the 2010 Alister MacKenzie Invitational, shooting a school-record, 16-under 197. Edged teammate Todd Baek and the University of California's Ben An by a shot at The Meadow Club in Fairfax, Calif…First college tournament title came in co-champion style at the Turtle Bay Invitational in Hawaii. Tied with teammate Andrew Cooley at the event in Kahuku.
tourBios.personal: Was a college teammate of PGA TOUR China Series' alum Todd Baek.

tourBios.curYearHigh: Recaptured a fully exempt PGA TOUR China Series' status by finishing T12 at the First Global Qualifying Tournament in Kunming. Began the final round outside the top 15—tied for 24th—but a 5-under 67, the low round of the day, moved him into the fully exempt position.

dyn.dynBios: Sister is LPGA star Danielle Kang
dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA Tour China Serie was T12th in 2015 at the Lushan Open.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks 51st in Scoring Average (Actual) on the PGA Tour China Series.
